definition: subdivision or branch of an organization/news bureau

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Customers can request bookings can through mail and phone, or by directly visiting one of the agencies.
sentences.chinese: 客户可以通过邮件和电话或直接到某个分社请求预订。

sentences.english: And we just built businesses and divisions around.
sentences.chinese: 就一直在扩大业务，建立分社。

sentences.english: I’m from International Travel Service, Beijing Branch.
sentences.chinese: 来自国际旅行社北京分社。

sentences.english: Haas is a news assistant in The Times' Beijing bureau.
sentences.chinese: 哈斯是《时代周刊》北京分社的新闻助理。

sentences.english: Jaime Flor Cruz is CNN's Beijing Bureau Chief and correspondent.
sentences.chinese: 海梅弗洛尔克鲁斯是CNN驻北京分社社长和记者。

definition: to halt/to stay/to be stationed (of troops, diplomats etc)
(abbr. for 對外宣傳|对外宣传[dui4 wai4 xuan1 chuan2]) (one's own) international public relations efforts/(another nation's) external propaganda
abbr. for 中國文學藝術界聯合會|中国文学艺术界联合会, China Federation of Literary and Art Circles (CFLAC)
